'''''Mythlore'' 103/104''' ([https://dc.swosu.edu/mythlore/vol27/iss1/ Volume 27, Issue 1/2]) is an issue of the ''[[Mythlore]]'' journal, published by the [[Mythopoeic Society]].

==Contents==

====Articles====

* Hammond, Wayne G., and Christina Scull. "In Memoriam: Pauline Baynes."
* Croft, Janet Brennan, and Edith Crowe. "Pauline Baynes in ''Mythlore''."
* Kane, Douglas C. "Reconstructing Arda: Of FÃ«anor and the Unchaining of Melkor."
* Riga, Frank P. "Gandalf and Merlin: J.R.R. Tolkien's Adoption and Transformation of a Literary Tradition."
* Berman, Lauren. "Dragons and Serpents in J.K. Rowling's ''Harry Potter'' Series: Are They Evil?"
* Nelson, Marie. "Time and J.R.R. Tolkien's 'Riddles in the Dark'."
* Wilkerson, Ginna. "So Far From the Shire: Psychological Distance and Isolation in ''The Lord of the Rings''."
* Brisbois, Michael J. "The Blade Against the Burden: The Iconography of the Sword in ''The Lord of the Rings''."
* MacLeod, Jeffrey J., and Anna Smol. "A Single Leaf: Tolkien's Visual Art and Fantasy."
* Christopher, Joe R. "The Non-Dead in John Dickson Carr's ''The Burning Court''."
* Basso, Ann McCauley. "Fair Lady Goldberry, Daughter of the River."
* Taylor, Taryne Jade. "Investigating the Role and Origin of Goldberry in Tolkien's Mythology."

====Features====

*Croft, Janet Brennan. Editorial.
*Letters: Ruth Lacon.

====Reviews====

* ''Planet Narnia: The Seven Heavens in the Imagination of C.S. Lewis.'' Michael Ward. Reviewed by Joe R. Christopher.
* ''Owen Barfield: Romanticism Comes of Age: A Biography.'' Simon Blaxland-de Lange. Reviewed by John D. Rateliff.
* ''Arthurian Writers: A Bibliographical Encyclopedia.'' Ed. Laura Cooner Lambdin and Robert Thomas Lambdin. Reviewed by Alexei Kondratiev.
* ''Hunting the Unicorn: A Critical Biography of Ruth Pitter.'' Don W. King. Reviewed by Joe R. Christopher.
* ''Inside Language: Linguistic and Aesthetic Theory in Tolkien.'' Ross Smith. Reviewed by Jason Fisher.
* ''The Voice of the Heart: The Working of Mervyn Peake's Imagination.'' G. Peter Winnington. Reviewed by Alice Mills.
* ''Tolkien On Fairy-stories.'' J.R.R. Tolkien. Expanded edition, with Commentary and Notes by Verlyn Flieger and Douglas A. Anderson. Reviewed by Jason Fisher.
